Webpack Demo

Webpack is based upon the idea that you pass in multiple files and it outputs just one file.

This is great for javascript as it means that Webpack will read all your files, and merge them together to make one file which can be read by any browser.

Webpack by default uses something called babel to transpile javascript from modern versions (such as ES6) to old versions depending on how far back you want to go.

This setup is just using Webpack's default settings, however you can create a webpack.config.js that allows you to customise the tasks that are run and also extract out css so that you can have that compiled through webpack too.

To see this working in a really quick demo go to the console and view the log message, you can then change the message in the src files and see a different log message when you refresh.
